alerts.title: California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA)
alerts.summary: The California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA), effective January 1, 2020, provides consumers with rights regarding their personal information, including rights to know, delete, and opt-out of sale of personal information.
alerts.fullText: The California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA), codified as Cal. Civ. Code § 1798.100 et seq., was signed into law on June 28, 2018. The law grants California residents the right to know what personal information is being collected about them, whether their personal information is sold or disclosed and to whom, the right to delete personal information held by businesses, and the right to opt-out of sale of personal information. The law applies to businesses that collect consumers' personal data and meet certain thresholds.
requirements: Right to know what personal information is being collected
Right to know whether personal information is sold or disclosed and to whom
Right to delete personal information held by businesses
Right to opt-out of sale of personal information
Right to non-discrimination for exercising privacy rights

impactAssessment.financialImpact: Civil penalties up to $2,500 per violation or $7,500 per intentional violation
impactAssessment.operationalImpact: Requires data mapping, privacy policies, and consumer request procedures

alerts.title: General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)
alerts.summary: The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) (EU) 2016/679 is a regulation in EU law on data protection and privacy in the European Union and the European Economic Area.
alerts.fullText: The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) (EU) 2016/679 is a regulation in EU law on data protection and privacy in the European Union (EU) and the European Economic Area (EEA). The GDPR aims primarily to give control to individuals over their personal data and to simplify the regulatory environment for international business by unifying the regulation within the EU. Superseding the Data Protection Directive 95/46/EC, the regulation contains provisions and requirements related to the processing of personally identifiable information of individuals living in the EU, and applies to all enterprises, regardless of location, that are doing business with the EU.

impactAssessment.financialImpact: Administrative fines up to €20 million or 4% of annual global turnover
impactAssessment.operationalImpact: Requires comprehensive data protection policies, procedures, and DPO appointment

alerts.source: Official Journal of the European Union

alerts.title: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA)
alerts.summary: The Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPAA) is a United States federal law that provides data privacy and security provisions for safeguarding medical information.
alerts.fullText: The Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPAA) Public Law 104-191 is a United States federal law that provided the first nationwide standards for protecting individuals' medical records and other personal health information. It gives patients more control over their health information, sets boundaries on the use and release of health records, establishes appropriate safeguards that must be implemented to protect the privacy of protected health information, and holds violators accountable with civil and criminal penalties.
requirements: Privacy Rule protects individually identifiable health information
Security Rule addresses electronic transmission of health information
Breach Notification Rule requires notification of breaches
Enforcement Rule governs compliance and investigations

impactAssessment.financialImpact: Penalties up to $1.5 million per violation category per year
impactAssessment.operationalImpact: Requires extensive privacy and security policies

alerts.title: Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA)
alerts.summary: The Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA) is a United States federal law that establishes minimum wage, overtime pay, recordkeeping, and child labor standards.
alerts.fullText: The Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 (FLSA) is a United States federal law that establishes minimum wage, overtime pay, recordkeeping, and child labor standards affecting full-time and part-time workers in the private sector and in Federal, State, and local governments. Covered nonexempt workers are entitled to a minimum wage of not less than $7.25 per hour. Overtime pay at a rate not less than one and one-half times the employee's regular rate of pay is required after 40 hours of work in a workweek.
requirements: Overtime pay at 1.5x regular rate after 40 hours/week

alerts.title: Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (FCPA)
alerts.summary: The Foreign Corrupt Practices Act of 1977 (FCPA) is a United States federal law that prohibits U.S. companies and individuals from bribing foreign officials to obtain or retain business.
alerts.fullText: The Foreign Corrupt Practices Act of 1977 (FCPA), Pub.L. 95-91, 91 Stat. 730, 15 U.S.C. § 78dd-1, et seq., is a United States federal law known primarily for two of its main provisions: the anti-bribery provision and the accounting provision. The anti-bribery provision prohibits corrupt payments to foreign officials to obtain or retain business. The accounting provision requires companies to keep accurate books and records and maintain adequate internal accounting controls.
requirements: Prohibition on bribery of foreign officials

impactAssessment.financialImpact: Criminal penalties up to $2 million for companies, $250,000 for individuals
impactAssessment.operationalImpact: Requires robust compliance and monitoring systems

alerts.title: Personal Data Protection Act (PDPA)
alerts.summary: The Personal Data Protection Act 2012 (PDPA) is Singapore's baseline data protection law that governs the collection, use, disclosure and care of personal data.
alerts.fullText: The Personal Data Protection Act 2012 (No. 26 of 2012) is Singapore's baseline data protection law that governs the collection, use, disclosure and care of personal data. It establishes a comprehensive and balanced framework for the protection of personal data while allowing the legitimate use of such data. The PDPA creates a baseline standard for organizations to follow in respect of the collection, use and disclosure of personal data about individuals.
requirements: Consent obligation for collection, use or disclosure
Notification of purpose and manner of collection

impactAssessment.businessImpact: Significant for businesses operating in Singapore
impactAssessment.financialImpact: Financial penalties up to S$1 million
impactAssessment.operationalImpact: Requires data protection policies and consent mechanisms

alerts.title: Cybersecurity Law of the People's Republic of China
alerts.summary: The Cybersecurity Law of the People's Republic of China governs network operations, data protection, and cybersecurity in China.
alerts.fullText: The Cybersecurity Law of the People's Republic of China, passed by the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress on November 7, 2016, and effective from June 1, 2017, is China's foundational cybersecurity regulation. It establishes requirements for operators of critical information infrastructure, data localization requirements, and cybersecurity protection obligations for network operators.
requirements: Security protection obligations for network operators
Data localization for critical information infrastructure operators

impactAssessment.businessImpact: Critical for businesses operating in China
impactAssessment.operationalImpact: Requires data localization and security measures

alerts.title: Personal Data Protection Act B.E. 2562 (2019)
alerts.summary: Thailand's Personal Data Protection Act (PDPA) governs the collection, use, and disclosure of personal data in Thailand.
alerts.fullText: The Personal Data Protection Act B.E. 2562 (2019) is Thailand's primary data protection legislation, which became effective on May 27, 2020. The Act applies to the collection, processing, and utilization of personal data, whether by manual or automatic means, during the course of business conducted in Thailand or involving personal data of Thai citizens.

impactAssessment.businessImpact: Significant for businesses operating in Thailand
impactAssessment.operationalImpact: Requires compliance with data subject rights and consent
